DOC.HEAD: Note Yields Fall
DOC.TEXT: Yields on two-year Treasury notes fell in Tuesday's auction to the lowest level since March 1988. The average yield was 7.71 percent, down from 7.78 percent at the last auction on Nov. 28. It was the lowest rate since two-year notes averaged 7.39 percent on March 23, 1988. The notes will carry a coupon interest rate of 7| percent with each $10,000 in face value selling for $9,984.60. A total of $10.01 billion in notes was sold out of bids totaling $23.15 billion.
